intro: Gomphia brachyandra var. ovata, commonly known as the broad-leafed gomphia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family, which includes many grass-like plants adapted to arid and coastal environments. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically arranged in dense, tufted clusters at the base. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, often clustered in spike-like inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal dunes or rocky habitats.
